title: Full Stack Engineer (React/Python)

Full Stack Engineer (React/Python)

Austin HQ

Full Time Mid-level / Intermediate USD 140K - 150K
  • Website
  • LinkedIn
  • @literati ùïè

Literati

View all jobs at Literati

Apply now Apply later

Posted 1 day ago

Think of your favorite book from childhood. Got it? Great. Now, that warm, joyful feeling you have right now‚Äîthat‚Äôs what we do. Literati is a modern children‚Äôs book company focused on building reading skills so kids can grow to be their best selves. We make it easy to find books kids love through school book fairs, book clubs, and classrooms using a unique mix of expert curation and data science. We‚Äôre on a mission to help parents ignite a love of learning and a love of life.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be focused on supporting our consumer-facing systems for our school store, kids club products as well new school fundraising initiatives. You will play a crucial role in designing and building compelling user experiences in support of customer growth and retention. You‚Äôll be an essential part of the team that is helping to improve children‚Äôs literacy across the United States. As part of a small team there will be many opportunities for personal and career growth. You will also get the opportunity to work alongside some of the preeminent experts in the field of machine learning and personalization.

In this role you will be expected to work with product owners/managers across the company and participate in sprint grooming, planning, and retrospective sessions. Collaborating with your Engineering teammates, you will leverage your expertise to enhance our overall Engineering processes for efficient software delivery to market. The Literati Store is a highly customized ecommerce platform built on next.js that supports thousands of bookfairs, teachers, and parents in their fundraising efforts. You will be supporting our efforts to improve their experience and expand our product offerings to help them raise more money for their schools.

Literati‚Äôs current stack (which you will help to define and evolve) includes terraform-driven provisioning in GCP, helm-driven kubernetes hosting for services, a mix of Django, nodejs, and wordpress application servers, and postgres databases in cloud SQL. We monitor using DataDog, Sentry, and cloud logging.

To be equitable to all Literatians, we have set compensation and a non-negotiation policy- we don't think a person‚Äôs pay should be determined by how comfortable they negotiate. As a result, we like to be transparent and up-front about the compensation. When we make an offer, we can provide options so that employees can choose between compensation packages that prioritize salary or equity. The salary band for this role will be between $140,000 - $150,000 depending on experience.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years of experience defining and leading web application server architecture initiatives

  • 3+ years of experience building web applications using React

  • Expertise in API and Data Model design

  • Proficiency with Front End technologies, including CSS and JavaScript frameworks

  • Proficiency with Python

  • Strong communication skills to convey architectural perspectives and monitor implementations

  • Experience developing tests that ensure performance, quality, and scalability

  • Proven success delivering in an agile environment

  • Proficiency with tools such as Git, Shortcut/Jira, etc.

  • Demonstrated leadership in engineering environments through operational excellence, best practices, and mentoring junior developers

WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO SEE

  • Experience with Literati‚Äôs full tech stack (Python/Django, React, Kubernetes, etc.)

  • Ability to work with the product team and customers to define requirements to build out new features.

  • Experience implementing and documenting engineering processes and standards;

ABOUT LITERATI

Literati was recently named Inc. magazine‚Äôs 7th fastest growing company in Texas, the 77th fastest in the United States and included in Built In Austin‚Äôs Best Places to Work for four years (2022-2025). Jessica Ewing, Literati‚Äôs Founder and CEO, was named one of ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äôs Top 12 Most Innovative Minds‚Äù by Fast Company. We‚Äôve raised over $60M in venture capital to date, with key investors including Founders Fund, General Catalyst, Felicis,01A, and Stephen Curry‚Äôs SC30.

We offer competitive salaries, company equity, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401k, short-term disability insurance, parental leave, employee assistance programs, flexible work schedules, and flexible time off.

We are dedicated to cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and connectedness that sees, reflects, welcomes, and celebrates the innovation and talent of a diverse array of people. We seek people with drive and a touch of alchemy. We also recognize that some people ‚Äî particularly underrepresented groups, women, BIPOC, LGBTQ+, etc. ‚Äî may not be comfortable applying to a position unless they meet 100% of the qualifications. Even if your experience isn‚Äôt a precise match for the role, we highly encourage you to apply. And if your career has taken you to some spectacular ‚Äî or spectacularly strange ‚Äî places, we love a good story.

Apply now Apply later
